page.title: 11HALLOWE'EN CUSTOMS
page.content: {TURNIP LANTERNS.}A good sized and shaped turnip is hollowed out, eyes, nose and mouth cut out; a candle stuck inside and lit. The children carry this from house to house of neighbours, doing "Hallowe'en Knock". They may be given a few pence. {Children's parties}are held, where these games are played.{DUCKING.}A bowl or basin is filled with water. Apples, nuts and some coins are put in, and the children duck for these. The most skilled can take the coins from the bottom, with their lips. {APPLES}are tied from the ceiling on a long string, and each child tries to bite the apple without using hands. {BONEFIRES,}as they are correctly pronounced, are sometimes burnt.{APPLE {TARTS}containing small coins or favours are baked and eaten. This is also the season for {TOFFEE APPLES.
